triples.evidence: it allows us to measure motion at a specific depth
The resulting frequency shift corresponds to the Doppler frequency, which reflects the motion or velocity of the surface or fluid
triples.o: motion or velocity of the surface or fluid

evidence: This mathematical operation converts the time-domain signal into a frequency-domain representation.
The resulting frequency shift corresponds to the Doppler frequency, which reflects the motion or velocity of the surface or fluid.
We record this oscillating signal over time and then perform a Fourier transform on it.
By analyzing these Doppler frequencies, we can quantify that motion precisely.
It's slightly more complex than continuous wave Doppler, but it has a major advantage - it allows us to measure motion at a specific depth.

concepts.term: the measured signal amplitude will fluctuate up and down around the average line

triples.evidence: The peak of the echo signal shifts forward in time. This small timing change, or phase shift, tells us that motion has occurred.
